definition: one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
lone/lonely

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
few/scant/widowed
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: He was suspected to be a loner with difficulty experienced during relationships.
sentences.chinese: 他懷疑是孤家寡人的困難所經歷的人際關係。

sentences.english: I said that professional writers are solitary drudges who seldom see other writers.
sentences.chinese: 我說職業作家是很少能見到其他作家的孤家寡人。

sentences.english: We are able to ask the question "Are we alone in the universe?"
sentences.chinese: 我們能夠問出“我們在宇宙中是孤家寡人嗎？”

sentences.english: The tactics of closed-doorism are, on the contrary, the tactics of the regal isolationist.
sentences.chinese: 關門主義的策略則是孤家寡人的策略。

sentences.english: Everybody was in the army; I was the odd man out, excluded.
sentences.chinese: 人人都在軍隊裏，我卻被排斥在外成了孤家寡人。

sentences.english: In the bigger international picture, Cuba is no longer such a unique case.
sentences.chinese: 在國際上，古巴不再是孤家寡人了。
